Subject: London2012 Venue misnaming

Hi Andy,

I've just received a couple of tickets from Andrew Chaplin about some of the Venues being misnamed. I've added the contents of the tickets below.

First ticket

"Hi Service Desk

I am doing a little work and using the London 2012 Completion schedules and the Olympic schedule still has the Handball Arena named as the 'Olympic Park-Handball Arena' and lists no sports competitions when selected.

However, when selecting 'Handball' from the sport drop-down list, the venue is displayed as the 'Copper Box'.

This will confuse the public, and I believe should be listed in the venue drop-down selections for both Olympic and Paralympic venues as the 'Copper Box'?

Regards,

Andy"

Second Ticket

"Hi Service Desk

The same applies for the Hockey Centre, which should be the Riverbank Arena.

Going through the Competition schedules the Olympic and Paralympic schedules still have the Hockey Centre named as the 'Hockey Centre' and lists no sports competitions when selected. However, when selecting 'Paralympic Seven-a-side' from the sport drop-down list, the venue is displayed as the 'Riverbank Arena'. This will confuse the public, and i believe should be listed in the venue drop-down selections for both Olympic and Paralympic venues as the 'Riverbank Arena'?

Andy"

Thanks,

Darren Daley

subject: Configure https://festival.london2012.com
description: Could you configure https://festival.london2012.com not to re-direct requests for  to www.london2012.com, this task is a follow up to ticket #4601

comments.value: Could you configure https://festival.london2012.com not to re-direct requests for  to www.london2012.com, this task is a follow up to ticket #4601
<VirtualHost *:443> directive needed for festival. Kieran, ok if I leave this with you?
Although, post your conversation with BT, is this still one for us?
Russ, what do you want the behaviour to be?

Unless the certificate is a wildcard cert, it's not quite as simple as just adding a VirtualHost directive.
In fact, it's a lot trickier.
Basically, you can't do name-based virtual host matching over ssl (as - until the secure session is established, the "Host" http header can't be read).
There is no obvious front-runner solution for this:
   http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/ssl/ssl_faq.html#vhosts2
Possible solutions are:
 1. Make web01,02,05 listen to (e.g.) port 442, and use that to serve the festival site over SSL. This would require either the load balancer, or t Akamai to map port external:443->internal:442.

 2. Make web01,02,05 listen on two IP addresses. Apache would listen on CurrentIP:443 for the www site, and NewIP:443 for the festival site.

 3. (As mentioned at the start of the email) get a *.london2012.com certificate. Name-based VirtualHosts can then be used. See (for example) http://nostacktrace.com/dev/2010/1/30/apache-ssl-and-name-based-virtual-hosts.html

Kieran

It needs to remain on https - it is the thing we spoke about before where kitsite either need to create their own self signed certificate or just copy the london2012 one.  We are going to be moving the entire site to https even though the signup stuff is done through eDialog.
Russ, this is non-trivial. It is really one for BT, not us.
One other option: Dedicate one server to running https://festival and two for https://www

This support ticket has been automatically closed.

For support assistance please contact support@kitsite.com
For general information concerning Kitsite or PostCMS  please contact info@kitsite.com

thanks

subject: Ceremonies form amds
description:
Hello

Just spoke to Jamie re: some last-minute (of course) requirements from the Ceremonies team.

They want to update the phase 2 form so that it shows the new dates for Olympic auditions. As per conversation with Jamie, we think all that is required is for Campbell in the Ceremonies team to update the dates which are fed into the system on his end. That should then update the dates offered to users to select from on the phase 2 form. Does that sound right?

Their other requirement is  to uncheck the 'Stage 2 complete' box for people who failed to show to auditions, so the Ceremonies team can email them to invite them to choose another audition slot. I assume we need to supply you with a list of those people or their Ids so you can do this?

Also NB: there are some changes required to the Olympic form to repurpose it for the Paralympic ceremonies on 9 Jan; I'll send these changes through separately.

Thanks!
Morag

Hi Susannah

1. The news on the home page is actually a separate include (see attached). 

Publishing the homepage doesn't re-publish the include.

Although publishing the new article /should/ publish the include (we looking at why that didn't happen)

Anyway, it's appearing now..
http://www.london2012.com/index.php

2) i think the reason the Local Leaders section has broken links is that some of that section was deliberately held back on the staging server at Morag's request.

The CMS has no way of knowing which pages have been held back on staging (as it is outside of the CMS and instead is part of the hosting setup) hence the broken links (as far as the CMS is concerned the page you are linking to is live and published).

The staging server isn't and was never intended to serve this purpose, it was simply to test out changes existing pages or hold back brand new sections before they got pushed live.

If you do use the staging server in this way ie. ask us to hold back individual pages/sections, if those pages are subsequently published you can't link to them from other pages in the CMS or else you'll end up with broken links.

In short holding parts of the site back on the staging server in this way leads to problems, especially it pages are held back for extended periods of time and/or mixed in with live pages.

The best way to handle pre-publish / preview is simply to not publish the pages and view then in the CMS via the preview button.

If the Local Leaders section is ready to go live now, we can remove an syncing-block (on staging) re-publish all the pages in that section, which should solve any issues with broken links.

Should we do that? can we publish all the pages the /get-involved/local-leaders/ section?

Jamie




Screen shot 2012-02-10 at 16.13.44.png

Hi Jamie,

I think Morag may now have spoken to you about this. Sorry for the confusion, I’m covering for Michael who’s currently away so everything got a little lost in translation. All of the local leaders pages can indeed be published as I think Morag may have already said.

The first point does seem to have resolved itself which is always good news.

Many thanks,
Susannah

No problem,

Will publish everything now..

Jamie

subject: 'Share' functionality embedding into Local Leaders pages on London2012.com
description:
Hi folks.

We've had a request from the Local Leaders team to make the social sharing functionality (as we currently have in the footer for Facebook and Twitter) more prominent and more specific.

If you look here: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/index.php you'll see there are 8 different 'products' which are going to make up the Local Leaders campaign as a whole ('Garden for the Games', 'Opening Night In' etc). As I understand it these products are going to have their own pages soon and the Local Leaders team want to embed clearly branded 'Like' and 'Tweet' buttons into the body of each page. They also want to make sure that


a)      The resulting pre-populated Facebook and Twitter posts contain more specific copy than just e.g. the page title. See here: http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/customiser for where we achieved this for the mascot site (share buttons for Twitter and Facebook are in the bottom right)

b)      An appropriate thumbnail is pulled through on the Facebook post.

I know this raises a few issues that we've discussed previously:


1)      Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

2)      Ditto re: how much we can customise the copy the content that is pre-populated into Twitter / Facebook posts.

The final question is can you please give me some estimates of how long it would take to do the work required (if possible?). The Local Leaders team are looking for an estimate.

Cheers all, hope that makes sense...

Finn Concannon (@finndc)
Lead Social Media Producer
LOCOG New Media

Hi Finn,

I'm trying to find my way though this ticket. Regarding

1) Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

I am not sure what the Facebook thumbnail issue is but i would guess that you'd like a title/description/image meta data for for every page on london2012? 

Can you sort me out with these details:

- title: { kitsite: get pageTitle }
- type : could you pick one: http://developers.facebook.com/docs/opengraph/#types 
- url: { kitsite: url }
- image: we could have a generic image like the 2012 olympics logo or a generate a thumbnail for each page ()
- site_name: suppose this is "London 2012"
- description: i would say we use the "meta_desctiption" field for this as we do for the normal meta:description field, i think i would make sense to keep them consistant 

Thanks
Lars

Hey all, just picking this up after I dropped the ball a bit in the run up to Xmas

Lars said: "I am not sure what the Facebook thumbnail issue is but i would guess that you'd like a title/description/image meta data for for every page on london2012?"

Correct. Currently most pages on London2012.com don't pull through the right details on Facebook posts. We usually get the page title and a vaguely relevent meta description (which is fine, as these can be edited anyway) but the only thumbnail that ever gets to be pulled through (if any) is our permanant advertising banner that is site wide. If tou look at the attachment to this message you'll see it's currently pulling in the 'get ready to celebrate' banner from our site which has nothing to do with the page we're linking to.

I wasn't sure whey you're asking me for those details? Do you need that for every single page on the site if we want this to work site wide rather than just on the Local Leaders pages? That'll be a seriously big task. Is there no way to code the page so that Facebook gives users the choice of using any image on the page as a thumbnail? I don't know if you remember the old homepage of the Festival site (at www.london2012.com/festival which was a grid of lots of different images. Facebook used to give you the option to cycle through any of those images and choose which one went into the post (this post from a few months back is an example of that. The thumbnail was taken directly from www.london2012.com/festival, which you'll see is linked in the post: http://www.facebook.com/london2012festival#!/london2012festival/posts/131481493602063

Thoughts on the above, folks?

PS - I found this in an old ticket that closed because it got old...

"Probably the correct way to solve this issue is to use Facebook's Open Graph Protocol: http://developers.facebook.com/docs/opengraph/ 

This would not mean changing the facebook code at all, but it would mean adding code to the header of the page.
We could probably add a single "<meta property="og:image" content="http://www.london2012.com/some-image.jpg"/>" to the top of all pages. 

Alternatively, we could probably allow the content of this tag to be specified page by page, but this would add an extra layer of editorial effort and require a bit of coding.

The simplest approach would be a single new metatag to be added to all pages which could possibly be done in under a day (almost all of which would be confirming this approach will work, testing and deployment, rather than actual development).

Other approaches would take more time, depending on what we actually ended up doing."

I don't think a one-size-fits-all approach to the metadata that's pulled into Facebook will work, it needs to be context specific. Does that mean I need to choose the pages we're most likely to link to and provide the metadata we'd like for each one?

Hey Finn, I'm testing this since a couple of days :) I've written a logo pulling function and hooked it up to the meta-description field, so we can use the existing data?! It has caused me some problems with pages that have no meta-data description. I'd like to give it one more day to see eventual problems appearing. 

It should be on every page in preview looking like this:

         <meta property="og:title" content="About us | London 2012" />
         <meta property="og:type" content="game" />
         <meta property="og:url" content="http://www.london2012.com/about-us" />
         <meta property="og:image" content="http://www.london2012.com/images/logos/logo-para.png" />
         <meta property="og:site_name" content="London 2012" />
        <meta property="og:description" content="How was the bid won? Where's the money coming from? Who's making it all happen? The 'About us' section answers all this and more..." />
         

so far so good ~

1. If there is no meta-desciption, shall we display a generic one?
2. is og:image ok to use the logo for this section, we could add a meta field for this or try to get the first image in the page resized ( quite small tho )

Let me know your thoughts
Lars

Hey Lars, this is great, thank you.

“I've written a logo pulling function and hooked it up to the meta-description field, so we can use the existing data?!”

Cool, sounds sensible. Users can edit that anyway, we just need something to appear to begin with.

“If there is no meta-desciption, shall we display a generic one?”

Yep – “Visit London2012.com” should do. Any way you can let me know which pages are missing metadescriptions and which aren’t? And would it be ok for me to specify some pages that I know we’ll definitely need a specific meta-description adding to?

“is og:image ok to use the logo for this section, we could add a meta field for this or try to get the first image in the page resized ( quite small tho )”

That idea about resizing the first image on the page would be ideal. Appreciate it’s going to be small. Ideally I could specify some pages where we know that a certain image would be best to use as well?

Hey Finn,

Re: Any way you can let me know which pages are missing meta-descriptions and which aren’t? 

I've done a search, we have > 5000 pages with and > 5000 pages without the meta-descition field filled in ( i limited the search to 5000 so the cms would not slow down for you guys ) I think maybe its best to pick pages maybe via google analytics that make sense to have a meta-desctiption and check them manually?

Also! I think for pages that have a lat-lon location set in the page meta-data ( as i think most of the sport-locations have this ) i think we should include this data in the facebook og:data as well. What you think? 

Also 2! Same for videos, shall we use the opengraph video tags on video pages?

I am currently working on the image resizing.

Let me know,
Lars

Hi Lars / All. Responses to your responses are below. A couple of things first though:


1) I’ve lost track of your thoughts on if / when we could add ‘Like’ (Facebook share) ‘tweet’ (Twitter) etc buttons to the body of individual Local Leaders pages. So e.g. on this page: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets/ the ‘Like’ / ‘tweet’ buttons will pre-populate with info about Line The Streets and a link back to the page. I know that Twitter allows you to easily generate the code for the ‘tweet’ button, and I’m thinking that the work we’re doing sorting out Facebook ‘Like’ share functionality metadata at the moment should help us get that button sorted too?

2) The first pages we’d like to manually enter the metadata to appear in ‘Like’ share posts on Facebook will be for Local Leaders. If I get that info for you now can we get it added to the pages ASAP

3) Responses to your responses


Lars said:
I think maybe its best to pick pages maybe via google analytics that make sense to have a meta-desctiption and check them manually?

FC - I agree, will arrange this.

Lars said: Also! I think for pages that have a lat-lon location set in the page meta-data ( as i think most of the sport-locations have this ) i think we should include this data in the facebook og:data as well. What you think?

FC - Don’t see why not, good shout

Lars said: Also 2! Same for videos, shall we use the opengraph video tags on video pages?

FC – What will this do? Not familiar with it...

Lars said: I am currently working on the image resizing.

FC – How’s this going?

Hey Finn, 

This sounds all good to me, i don't see a problem with the facebook / twitter integration and we can get working and test 1)  and 2) there straight away so lets get it on.

~ Lets do the others after

Re image resizing, this went alright, its just that its currently on preview or staging, hence i could not test it cause facebook won't see them but local leaders will tell us.

I'll speak to Danny to get some time for this.

Lars

Thanks Lars, great news.

Shall I get the Local Leaders team to provide the wording they want for their Facebook Like (share) and Tweet for each page then?
Any news on timings Lars?

Hey Finn,

re: Shall I get the Local Leaders team to provide the wording they want for their Facebook Like (share) and Tweet for each page then?
Yes please, that would be great,

re: timing
how does tuesday next week sound?

Cheers
Lars
Ace, thanks Jamie
Hey Finn, sorry its actually Lars here, just had some password problems am here as jamie temporarily!
Hi Lars, how’s this coming along?
Hi Finn, Lars is working on this now. We will get back to you with an update later on this afternoon, but we are aiming for close of play today.
Great :-) Ta, will listen out

Hey Finn, so far:

Every Local leaders hub now takes a facebook url in the meta-data. Once you filled this in, a like button will appear. The styling and twitter still has to be done but you could start entering them urls in the metadata and i'll tie it all together. Hows that?

Cheers
Lars
Cool, I’ll take a look, thanks Lars

Hey Lars. Looking at this again I’m a bit confused. Why a Facebook page URL? Do you know there are no Local Leaders Facebook pages? The functionality that we’re looking for is same is if you select ‘Share this page --> Share on Facebook’ in the bottom corner of any page on London2012.com. We just want ‘Like’ buttons (which share rather than subscribe) that sit in the body of the Local Leaders pages.

Does that make sense? I’m not sure what you’ve done is quite what I was asking for?

Sorry, I thought there was a facebook page for each group. It shouldn't be a big deal, i can use the current pages url for the like button and will put a meta-data checkbox for "show facebook like" in the page. 

Will move to the bottom as well!
Makes sense. 

We'll figure it!
Lars

Hi Lars:

LB: “Sorry, I thought there was a facebook page for each group. It shouldn't be a big deal, i can use the current pages url for the like button and will put a meta-data checkbox for "show facebook like" in the page.”

Sounds good

LB: Will move to the bottom as well!

No need! Want it to be clearly visible. In each hub, could the Like (Share) and Tweet buttonst go where I’ve illustrated in this attachment (e.g. below the main image on the page)? We need a little distance between these buttons and the ones in the breadcrumb. I feel like this location would work.
Thanks for clarifying, i'm on the case!

Finn, how is this:

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets

I'm not sure what happened, has someone else edited this page? Some of the content seems to have gone missing on it, i'm not sure where. 

Do you still have it or was it removed on purpose?
Hows the social stuff, is that more in the right direction?

Let me know!
Lars

Hey Finn, current status:

~ to enable the Sharing buttons in the local leaders hub: tick the "showSharingOptions" checkbox in the meta-data
~ the Facebook description will be pulled in from the meta-description field.
~ the Twitter copy will be pulled in from a field called 'tweetCopy' which you can find in edit mode underneath the top image.
   in live this will automatically add "http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets via @london2012"
   in preview it will use the preview url.

Hope this is correct!
Lars

Hey Lars, thanks again for this. I’ve just been taking a look. - I’m able to enable and disable the sharing buttons in the way you’ve described, that’s great - Facebook share seems to work but doesn’t pull through an image - Using the ‘Line the Streets’ hub as an example, the Facebook metadata doesn’t seem to match the description that’s pulled through. It currently reads ‘Line the Streets metadata’ but when I shared it on my Facebook profile it read as ‘Welcome the Flame’. Not sure where the latter came from? - How do we get a thumbnail into the Facebook share? Still not pulling one through - I edited the Tweet copy and it worked but it also pulled in markup (added a
on the end of the Tweet copy). Can you fix that? - URL is pulled into tweets, would you be able to put that through our URL shortener so that it shortens automatically if I send you the API key?

Hey Lars, thanks again for this. I’ve just been taking a look. - I’m able to enable and disable the sharing buttons in the way you’ve described, that’s great - Facebook share seems to work but doesn’t pull through an image There is currently no page on the live server that contains facebook meta tags. As far as i know the local leaders section is 'locked down', and preview / staging are password protected and therefor not accessible for facebook. This is also the reason for the next point underneath: - Using the ‘Line the Streets’ hub as an example, the Facebook metadata doesn’t seem to match the description that’s pulled through. It currently reads ‘Line the Streets metadata’ but when I shared it on my Facebook profile it read as ‘Welcome the Flame’. Not sure where the latter came from? This page is edited and on preview, maybe on staging but facebook will look at the published page which has the standard meta tag: which facebook jumps on. You can check for the looks of things on staging servers though. Still the facebook share won't get the correct outcome here. - How do we get a thumbnail into the Facebook share? Still not pulling one through This should have been working but now that we have the include for the top-image this has become more quirk/tricky. I'm trying to find a way of automating it for the local leaders pages. - I edited the Tweet copy and it worked but it also pulled in markup (added a
on the end of the Tweet copy). Can you fix that? Fixed that - URL is pulled into tweets, would you be able to put that through our URL shortener so that it shortens automatically if I send you the API key? We were looking into this before and i am looking again. One more thing, Facebook seems to have a caching mechanism which i think takes about 1-2 days after you shared a page with them, we should consider this. Lets put it live soon or is this tricky because the new content shouldn't ? Lots of things! I'm working though them. Lars

I've written an url-shortener, which now automatically shortens the url when the page gets published and inserts it into the tweet after the twitter copy.

Quite happy with that :)

Lars

Hey Lars

URL shortener – nice one :-)

Local Leaders page is ‘locked down’ – To what extent? Does that mean I have to go to our Technology team to request a change? *sigh* Slightly odd that I’m asking you that but there we go...

‘The facebook share won't get the correct outcome here.’ – but it will once we publish, is that what you’re saying?

Thumbnail into Facebook share – cool, let me know how you’ve got on?

Fixed markup in tweet copy – thanks :-)

Get this live soon – have to wait for when the Local Leaders team publish them I’m afraid, I think they might be putting new content live tomorrow though.

Hey Finn,

URL shortener – nice one :-) 
>> i know!

Local Leaders page is ‘locked down’ – To what extent? Does that mean I have to go to our Technology team to request a change? *sigh* Slightly odd that I’m asking you that but there we go...

>> Locked down, i think that is the rsync filter on the server, i.e. locked down means its only publishing to staging, we can change this here, i don't think you need a change request.

‘The facebook share won't get the correct outcome here.’ – but it will once we publish, is that what you’re saying?
>> That's what i am saying. Also i'm saying, facebook caches results so we should give it a couple of days to de-cache. 

Thumbnail into Facebook share – cool, let me know how you’ve got on?
>> Got it working for the local leaders hub but am still battling with the rest of pages.

Fixed markup in tweet copy – thanks :-)

Get this live soon – have to wait for when the Local Leaders team publish them I’m afraid, I think they might be putting new content live tomorrow though.
>> That should be soon :) I would like to do this rather soon than later so we can fix problems before the weekend.

Lars
The Facebook image pulling out of pages using an image scroller-include is re-fixed, was broken due to multiple images....
and was broken again due to a workflow problem

Finn, I believe this is ready to close. We have added the sharing options to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/line-the-streets/

For any other Local Leaders hub page where you want the sharing options to display, you will need to check the "showSharingOptions" metadata checkbox and republish.

subject: Kitsite Review of proposed Apache configuration from BT
description:
We have sent Kitsite a proposed Apache configuration from BT that will be needed to be actioned to allow BT to manage the apache configuration on the Webservers.

We would like Kitsite to review the proposed configuration items and comment on any issues that they may have with implementing the recommended configuration.

The next strps from this will be to install the agreed apache configuration onto the staging servers stage03 and stage04 and performing regression testing.

Russ, it's going to take a fair amount of time to go through the items on this spreadsheet and give a proper response to each of the items marked "Application Developers to confirm any negative impact of making this standard config". With some of these item it may not be immediately obvious what the impact is likely to be and investigation will be required.

We estimate one day to do an initial assessment and point out where further research might be required.

Unfortunately, this request has hit us at a very busy time. We are not sure when we will be able to schedule time to give you an initial response. How soon do you need feedback?
As discussed with Danny - to be pushed to next month due to work load.

Hi Danny - as discussed yesterday we are now keen to get this back on track. This is especially as the mismatch in apache configs was a contributing factor to the issues that we experienced on the Festival launch.

We are looking to do this sometime late next week if we can get the appropriate resource together from BT to do this.

Kirsty from BT (cc on this) may contact you to arrange some time for a BT Apache expert to contact you.

Hope that will be OK with you guys.

Russ

This looks like an issue for Akamai. It's their certificate and the site is being served through their network. We have no control over this.
But should we not be ensuring that the sign-up elements are delivered via https://? They are not currently.

Hi Morag,

We don't / can't install the certificates on Akamai, that's something Technology will have to get Akamai to do.

Although, they are correct the web01-06 is not setup to deliver pages over SSL for festival.london2102.com as weren't made aware this was a requirement, neither do we have a certificate to use for festival.london2102.com 

If it has now become a requirement I think these are the rough step that need to happen:

btw. I am not entirely sure who last installed the www.london2102.com certificate and/or if we are allowed to install them [am trying to find Kieran to ask if he remembers]. Assuming for the moment we can generate the CSR / install the cert for you.

1/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to generate a CSR (certificate signing request) for festival.london2012.com
2/ LOCOG need to order a SSL certificate using that CSR (for use on web01-06)
3/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to instal the certificates on web01-06
4/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to update the Apache httpd.conf on web01-06
5/ Kitsite need to add a rule to each Apache httpd.conf to redirect form traffic to https and non-form traffic back to http
6/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to restart all web servers
7/ Kitsite need to update the HTML/JS to link to a https version of the signup form and the accessible version of the form [need to work out scope of those changes as the form is submitted via AJAX]
8/ We also need to check that every other asset (image, js, css etc.) on the page can also be loaded via https to get round mixed content warnings, as the site is effectively one large JS app this could be a non trivial process (hard to tell without some investigation).

ps. one thing to be aware of (before we embark on what is a non trivial amount of work) is that the form itself is served up empty (there is no personal data in an empty form) so there little advantage from a security perspective to serving an empty form that up as a https page (other than a padlock appearing). The only thing that *really* need to be made secure is the transmission of data from the form to the CMS once it is posted off. 

## I know you have very strict data protection requirements, but I would personally question how personal this data actually is? Is someone really going to sniff a network to capture someone email address? I just did a straw poll, but most (large) site capturing this data don't do it over HTTPS ie. the weekly newsletter signup form on TimeOut http://www.timeout.com/london/ ##

Kieran's not in today, but he's in the London office next week, we'll do out best to get back to you on Monday/Tuesday with a more confirmed list of tasks and timescales, with a provisional schedule to carry out the work (assuming you want us to press ahead with it).

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie – very very helpful.

Will relay to Technology and get them to make a call.

Ticket #4721 "Festival Website" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last comment in ticket #4721: This is a follow up to #4601.

Hi Danny

This one will not go away I am afraid.

Can we speak about how best to do this – understand Jamie’s concerns but our security folks have strict policies on the transmission of personal data.

As this is on Akamai can we not just put the whole thing on the Akamai secure network and use their wildcard *.london2012 certificate?

Russ

Hi Russ,

Given you now host the wildcard *.london2012 certificate cert with Akamai then yes, as you suggest, we could just serve the entire site over https.

Given that the site is basically a one page AJAX / JS driven site that probably isn't such a crazy idea (we probably need to revisit for festival phase II though)

Someone (not sure who manages the conf files in stage03/04 and web01/06 now) would just need to add a Apache rule to rewrite all http request back to a https alternative.

We'd also need to make sure that all the urls in the pages that reference assets do so via https urls so we don't get any mixed content warnings, this will still need some preliminary work (to check and migrate over any references) which we will need to schedule in.

One last thing, do we still need a SSL certificate installed on the server (even if just a self signed one) in order to ensure that the connection between the origin server and Akamai is over a secure transport or is the whole network inside of Akamai considered secure (even if those connections are only over http). I seem to remember Dom saying that the origin server did need a cert installed even if just a self signed one). If this is the case then we'd need to figure out who is to complete this work IPSoft or ourselves. This would need installing on stage03/04 and web01-06. 

Although I do wonder, in light of everything now sitting behind Akamai whether it would make sense to install a self signed wildcard cert (no reason for a proper one as no one will see it) on stage03/04 and web01-06 so that those servers are setup to handle any sub sites under the london2012.com domain.

Probably best Danny if you liaise with Russ on this / schedule any work in.

thanks

Jamie

Thanks Jamie – did not mean to go direct to Danny on this when you had given such a comprehensive answer.

Russ

Hi Russ,

No, I just meant could Danny (who was cc'd in) pick this ticket back up to figure out a schedule / thrash out the details with you for getting this work done.

Not that Danny is my PA ;-) It's just that he has a better overall picture of our availability and probably has more time than me this week to discuss the finer details with yourself and Akamai.

thanks

Jamie

Russ, regarding Jamie's list of tasks added in July:

1/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to generate a CSR (certificate signing request) for festival.london2012.com 
2/ LOCOG need to order a SSL certificate using that CSR (for use on web01-06) 
3/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to instal the certificates on web01-06 
4/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to update the Apache httpd.conf on web01-06 
5/ Kitsite need to add a rule to each Apache httpd.conf to redirect form traffic to https and non-form traffic back to http 
6/ Kitsite (or ipsoft) need to restart all web servers 
7/ Kitsite need to update the HTML/JS to link to a https version of the signup form and the accessible version of the form [need to work out scope of those changes as the form is submitted via AJAX] 
8/ We also need to check that every other asset (image, js, css etc.) on the page can also be loaded via https to get round mixed content warnings, as the site is effectively one large JS app this could be a non trivial process (hard to tell without some investigation).

I can confirm that this is where responsibility lies:

1/ ipsoft need to generate a CSR (certificate signing request) for festival.london2012.com 
2/ LOCOG need to order a SSL certificate using that CSR (for use on web01-06) 
3/ ipsoft need to instal the certificates on web01-06 
4/ Kitsite need to update the Apache httpd.conf on web01-06 
5/ Kitsite need to add a rule to each Apache httpd.conf to redirect form traffic to https and non-form traffic back to http 
6/ ipsoft need to restart all web servers
7/ Kitsite need to update the HTML/JS to link to a https version of the signup form and the accessible version of the form [need to work out scope of those changes as the form is submitted via AJAX] 
8/ We also need to check that every other asset (image, js, css etc.) on the page can also be loaded via https to get round mixed content warnings, as the site is effectively one large JS app this could be a non trivial process (hard to tell without some investigation).

So, if you are able to liaise with IPsoft, BT and Akamai to get the certificate installed we should be able to do the rest.

As a follow up to this one and in particular with regard to items 2/ and 3/, our understanding is that the only way to have:
 - host1.london2012.com
 - host2.london2012.com
both listening on https/443

is to have a wildcard cert, for *.london2012.com

(because apache needs to know which cert to use BEFORE it inspects the virtual hosts and it doesn't know the hostname until it decrypts the request)

So it looks like somebody will need to set that up before we can proceed.
Incidentally, fwiw, the current cert is NOT a wildcard *.london2012.com cert (see attached - it's just for www.london2012.com).
Hi there - we are looking to re-ignite this ticket as there is another need to put the festival site on https.

Russ, this looks like one for BT. I don't think we can do anything on our end to get https://festival.london2012.com/settings/newsletter.php working. Although once it does work, we can of course change the Email signup links to point to the right place.
https://festival.london2012.com now appears to redirect to http://www.london2012.com/. Marking as solved.

Hi Morag,

The translations with an error are due to the fact that we cannot download them from the AL server. It returns a server 500 error (basically an internal error of some sort). Beyond that we have no means of establishing what the problem is. I think I send you an email regarding them, which you forwarded to Patrick, moderately recently. Did he/AL get back to you?

Regarding the "in progress" files, those are simply the filenames that are returned to us by the AL API. I asked them about them before, and was told (along the lines of) don't worry about them, they get created internally for [some reason].

In short I don't think the large number of in-progresses is anything to worry about, but I would like to get to the bottom of the server 500's if possible.

Kieran

subject: Re: London 2012 Translations
description:
Hi Patrick,
The way our feed works is that it calls:
  Job/File/completed
via your API. Any/all files that are listed in this response, it then
downloads and pushes into the CMS and thus onto the website.
I don't know what you mean by "uploading multiple files under one enquiry
number". Is this a billing terminology? Or does it mean that we should amend
our feed to work in a different fashion?
Put simply, if "Job/File/completed" returns it, we download and import it.

Unless... I'm just checking - are you saying that the XML files that you've
been returning to us contain more than one <document/> element? If so then
that certainly won't work, as the resulting document would not be valid XML
(as it would contain more than on root node). We can refactor our feed so
that it can deal with multiple <document/> elements in one file but it will
also require some development work at our end, and at your end - to make the
XML files valid by wrapping them in a - name-to-be-decided - root element.

Please can you clarify how you uploaded the batch-in-question, and how this
differed from the hitherto-working process.
Should "Job/File/completed" have returned them all individually?

Thanks, in advance,

Kieran

comments.value:
Hi Patrick,
The way our feed works is that it calls:
  Job/File/completed
via your API. Any/all files that are listed in this response, it then
downloads and pushes into the CMS and thus onto the website.
I don't know what you mean by "uploading multiple files under one enquiry
number". Is this a billing terminology? Or does it mean that we should amend
our feed to work in a different fashion?
Put simply, if "Job/File/completed" returns it, we download and import it.

Unless... I'm just checking - are you saying that the XML files that you've
been returning to us contain more than one <document/> element? If so then
that certainly won't work, as the resulting document would not be valid XML
(as it would contain more than on root node). We can refactor our feed so
that it can deal with multiple <document/> elements in one file but it will
also require some development work at our end, and at your end - to make the
XML files valid by wrapping them in a - name-to-be-decided - root element.

Please can you clarify how you uploaded the batch-in-question, and how this
differed from the hitherto-working process.
Should "Job/File/completed" have returned them all individually?

Thanks, in advance,

Kieran
